I guess you may be refering to this image here:​​​​Let me explain further:The orange component is actually the term life component (which is around 300k) hence also known as 3xThe blue part is actually the whole life component (which is around 100k)The focus as you can see is between 25 to 65 years old. Most term lifes end at 65 years old. Before the premiums paid yearly starts to climb rapidly till 99 years old. This is for very obvious reasons.​The whole idea is that during that period of 40 years, you would be in the prime of your earning potential of your life. Hence if you die, your dependents or family can actually get the most payout from your death.
